prompt:
Round 1

response:
Based on a subgame‐perfect analysis of the alternating offer game with discounting only on my (Alice’s) side (10% per round) and Bob being fully patient, the backward induction reasoning shows that if Bob rejects any round‑1 proposal, he will become the proposer in round 2 and can leave me (who suffers a discount penalty with each delay) virtually nothing. In other words, Bob’s “threat point” is essentially the entire $10,000. Therefore, to have Bob accept in round 1, I must offer him his full continuation value—which leaves me nothing.

Thus, my equilibrium offer in round 1 is to propose giving me $0 and Bob $10,000. (Any offer giving Bob less would lead him, acting rationally, to reject in favor of proposing later and capturing nearly the whole pie.)
